Posts.Content: PennStateMac wrote: Hi Everyone, I'm 35 years old.  4 days ago both of my breasts began to get really sore and tender.  I was concerned since my period isn't due until the middle of next week and I can't remember having breast pain so early out before.  I decided to do a self exam (I am pretty good about doing them every month).  When  felt around the top of my right breast I felt a very small lump.  Instantly my blood went cold.  I had my husband feel around as well and he agreed that he felt something too.  The next day I decided to get my long overdue mammogram my gyno gave me a script for in November.  When I called I explained that I also felt a lump and they got me in the next day for not only a screening but a diagnostic mammogram as well.  I had both done and then since I said I had an issue they also did an ultrasound.  Neither the tech nor the radiologist found anything "unusual" in the ultrasound.  They wanted me to follow up with my gyno though.  So I did and I went today thinking she would tell me things were fine.  She also felt around and found not one, but two lumps in my right right-one at 12 and the other at 11 from my nipple.  She said they were BB pellt sized lumps that were less than 1/2 cm each, but was concerned enough that she wanted me to see a breast surgeon.  Her office was able to get me in to see a great breast surgeon on Tuesday afternoon.  But now I am worried.  I walked in there thinking everything was fine from the testing and now I'm seeing a breast surgeon.  My mother was diagnosed 3 years ago with Inflammatory Breast Cancer and passed away shortly after.  So even though everything I am reading is telling me that the odds are in my favor, I can't help but be scared since I have lived through the rare cancer with my mom.  I'm turning here to see if this is just a logical step from a very thorough doctor or if this is the beginning of my own battle.  Any insight would be helpful and very much appreciated.  Thanks!  :-)   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump felt but did not show up in Mammo or ultrasound PennStateMac kehjj04

Posts.Content: PennStateMac wrote: Hi everyone.  My mom was just recently diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer four weeks ago.  She has had all the tests and scans dome and the cancer is at stage III and is a local spread to her left lymph node system and no where else.  She began her first treatment of chemo last week of both Taxol and Gemzar.  She had her second treatment of just Gemzar yesterday.  This morning she discovers a lump on her side.  She was having some abdominal swelling the past week and mentioned it to her doctor who didn't seem concerned.  Her blood count looked good yesterday and the lump wasn't there yesterday.  Could a cancerous lump appear overnight?  Could it have spread that quickly while on chemo or is this a side effect of the treatments?  I am hoping someone can help me or has experienced the same thing.  Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo and new lumps PennStateMac PennStateMac
